issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
* Removed obsolete hadoopVer from QTestUtil

 * Cleaned up QTestUtil, QTestArgumentsBuilder

 * Refactored AccumuloTestSetup, AccumuloQTestUtil due to findbugs violation:
(UR_UNINIT_READ_CALLED_FROM_SUPER_CONSTRUCTOR: Uninitialized read of field method called from constructor of superclass)

comments.body: [~pvary] could you please a look. Thank you!
No impact. There are no q.out files ending with hadoop version, like input1.q.out_mr_"0.20"

I think it is a good to have a little cleanup in QTestUtil.
[~kgyrtkirk]: Could you please verify that this will not break anything for your extra tests? (Like setting a class final or moving methods to private)
+1 from my side pending tests

Thank you [~dkuzmenko] for taking care of this!
I think that hadoopver is not used anymore...and since to my best knowledge even hive3 does not support even hadoop 2.x
I feel that this is not needed anymore...
according to https://hive.apache.org/downloads.html it seems to me that the last release line which was supporting multiple hadoop versions was branch-1
